description: Users of Microsoft SharePoint Server may encounter unexpected behaviors stemming from a remote code execution vulnerability outlined in CVE-2024-30100. The issue may manifest through irregular access to files or services within SharePoint, where end users might notice unauthorized actions being performed or data being altered without their consent. Additionally, users may experience increased error messages or system sluggishness when attempting to access specific features of SharePoint Server after the security patch deployment, indicating potential exploitation paths. This scenario can escalate the risk of unauthorized data exposure or modifications, directly impacting the trust and reliability of the SharePoint environment. Affected versions include Microsoft SharePoint Server Subscription Edition, SharePoint Server 2019, and SharePoint Enterprise Server 2016, with specific updates provided in KB-5002602, KB-5002603, and KB-5002604 respectively.
